poem:
Title: From the Frontlines of Forgotten

In Ireland's heart and the Dutchman's gaze,
Lebanon whispers a sorrowful phrase.
Unifil's silent hymns in the morning mist,
Retell stories of the words once hissed.
The inspections of the love and war,
Uniting nations on a distant shore,
Reflections on Israeli slurs and Arab tears,
Meld into a symphony for sympathetic ears.
